description: Just a wonderful, unassuming, top-class bistro.  Everything was quality from begininng to end.  We had such a good time there.  Service was delightful and humorous, the food creatively and expertly prepared, and ambience simple, yet elegant.  I'd return without hesitation.
author: David L.

description: The service was awful, management not so good, the restaurant was small, and the food was not good.  I have also had a problem with my reservation at this restaurant.
author: Mitch L.

description:
as always I love to try any restaurant that serves organic food. sometimes it is disappointing. but not at Fringale. The food is just awesome!!! 
My absolute favorite dish: Grass fed beef filet Mignon!!!!!! I am a beef lover, but I can't get it everywhere because of all the garbage they feed the cows!! but Grass fed!!! oh gosh!! The piece you get is thick very juicy, with a generous portion of greens and fries. And it is cooked however you asked it to be!!!! well done, done, medium is done!! Then is the organic chicken dish, sometimes is basquaise,, sometimes is organic chicken breast with side dish either way is great. 
I have to say this is the one place that gives a very good name to French restaurants. Their portions are good size (not too big not tiny!). The service is great but not pushy. The price is just right, for portion, quality of food and service. 
Any soup that I got here is great. and I like their vegetable salad, very healthy and tasty. It is cooked vegetables with vinaigrette (sounds simple but it is very tasty) 
Overall, it is one of my favorite places, and I go back again and again. 
But the only thing is it is very small place and so keep that in mind. 
oh I forgot my other favorite dish is the appitizer: Roquefort & spinach ravioli,sooooo good. 
I think that is it for now! :-)
author: Nina Z.

description:
We had the salmon tartare appetizer.  The waitress said it was supposed to be spicy but there was no heat in the dish at all.  

The halibut served with mashed potatoes and spinach was very good.  The fish was fresh and the fish cooked perfectly.  Unfortunately, the seafood bisque was not so fresh and the seafood was also overcooked.  The mussels were especially not fresh.  

We didn't get dessert, but the selection was standard.
author: Brian K.

description:
The restaurant:  compact, yet elegant, a small dining room with a coziness reminiscent of Paris... (i.e., the bar patrons are practically looking over some tables)

First Course:  I had the famed frisee salad, although I do not especially like frisee's texture.  This rendition included perfectly bite-sized pieces of frisee with healthy chunks of bacon.  Very good, with the attention to detail one might expect at this price point.  A very generous portion, although the acid went out of balance lower in the bowl.

Plats/Main:  I had the pork, which had delicately balanced flavors overall.  My dining companion's chicken was outstanding, with each perfectly trimmed piece cooked to juicy perfection.  To be honest, I can't recall much about my main because dessert....

Dessert:  Fantastic, and the best value of the menu.  Really the highlight of the meal, with a Gateau Basque and a Chocolate Gourmand both beautifully presented and exquisitely executed.  The Gateau featured a smooth custard filling redolant of whole vanilla inside a rich and dense almond tart.  The Gourmand was the "chocolate lava" cake taken to a whole new level -- with an outstanding presentation and a melted chocolate center that still expressed the spicy complexities of fine chocolate.  

I'm reserving my highest praise for the ambience at the price point was a bit lacking, although the service was excellent and the epitome of professionalism.    4.5 stars, but stay for dessert!
author: Greg K.

description:
We were heading over towards the city, and decided to call at 8:45pm to see if there's any reservations available on this past Saturday evening.  Fortunately, they did have availability, and were able to be seated within 10 minutes of our reserved time.  

The service was great, all the waiters were very professional and attentive.  My Australian sea bass did arrive undercooked, but when we sent it back, they were extremely apologetic and returned with a new entree within minutes.  

The food was delicious! The sea bass had just a tint of sweetness, with the light almond crust on top.  Our appetizers- calamari & ravioli were delicious! 

And, most of all, the price is very reasonable for a French restaurant!  The ambiance is cozy and romantic!  I highly recommend Fringale!
author: Vivian H.

description: This was our best DAT experience. It's a great place for a date: tiny, yet not at all loud, because the tables are spaced a decent distance apart. The service is really excellent, and the food is good-to-wonderful. My salmon was average, but my date's coq au vin was completely delicious and my chocolate gourmand dessert was absolutely excellent - and I am very demanding of my chocolate-based desserts. Overall it is unpretentious, very pleasant and tasty. We will likely go back.
author: Erika C.

description:
Had a WONDERFUL meal at Fringale last night.  I was with four others, and we each were not embarassed to try each other's meal.  The almond-crusted sea bass was absolutely phenomenal, and I have to say was probably the best fish I've had in a decade.  The saffron sauce accompanying I thought might be too overpowering, but it was exquisitely delicate and rounded out the almond crust quite nicely.  Even more surprising was the combination of chanterelles and the sauce. Wow.  The rack of lamb was outstanding and perfectly cooked; just two ribs, though.  The potato gratin accompanying was good, but had a slightly bitter taste.  Also tried the coq a vin, which literally melted in your mouth.  Another shine was the crispy skinned chicken - it had a very delicate almost lemon-pepper taste, and the skin perfectly crunchy.  

The deserts were all amazing as well.  Definitely go to this place; although it is very small, the space is accomodating and the staff superior.
author: Brenda F.

description:
I have been going to Fringale consistently for at least ten years, going through several changes of ownership. The owner used to be the main waiter there for quite a while. I recommend this restaurant without reservation (although I do recommend you make one) for either lunch or dinner. It is French bistro food without too many cliches, offers snappy service, and a dependable food experience. The wine list could be longer, but what they have is well chosen and there are some gems like the Paillard Champagne and great Rhone reds. 
This restaurant seems to get some bad reviews here and there from the usual befuddled set who do not know sweetbreads from brains, not that they have much of it. Do not be put off by these blathering reviews and put yourself in the hands of Jean-Marie, the new owner. He will treat you right.
author: Jean-Louis F.

description: Our dinner here was excellent. The seafood basquaise was just a little spicy, in need of a pinch of salt, and filled with great seafood. The hazelnut and almost genoise was creamy and paired perfectly with roasted almonds. The only thing wrong with the creme brulee was that a bit of it was burnt. Their specials sounded interesting and tasty. A great find.
author: Trisha P.

description: Another SF favorite.  When I want French food, to impress or just to enjoy, this is one of my 'go to' places.  French owned and run, unlike other "le" places, this place delivers great food, at good value (not cheap), they have wonderful french wine selection, and the staff is happy to give solid wine choices, and not up-sell pushing - I think the best Frisee salad in SF!  Reservations are a must becuase it is small, but well worth it.
author: Mike P.

description:
One of my friends rounded up the girls to try their DAT menu.

Mussels - nothing too exciting. It was good, just wasn't overly impressed. Large serving for one person

Flat iron steak - (Cooked Med-Rare) - It was great. Lot's of flavor and enjoyed every bite of it. Came with haricot verts (green string beans) and frittatas (french fries.) 

Warm chocolate gourmand - it was heavenly!!! Yummy Yummy! Wish I had a few more servings! Almost like a flourless warm lava chocolate cake.... it was beyond mouthwatering!

The place is super small. We sat right smack dab in the middle of the restaurant and had to adjust our seat whenever people passed by. The table was pretty small for a party of 4 girls .... small petite girls at that.

The server was nice. He was french and had trouble explaining the menu to us. Luckily our quick game of charades solved all of our questions.
author: Emma N.

description: Wow! My husband and I went to this restaurant for our anniversary. The setting was perfect and the staff very friendly and knowledgeable about the food. The dinner itself was amazing! We are planning on taking the whole family to celebrate our son's birthday soon. I would recommend this great restaurant to anyone interested in great food, great service and great setting. Fringale is amazing!
author: nathalie v.

description:
maybe 3.5 stars

so i went here for my friend's bday.

the food is good, we had better but i liked it. the problem was the
~SERVICE~
1) we were a big party, but when i ask him for menus, he gave us two....
maybe...we want menu for everyone???
2) didn't really explain the menu to us, because it was french bistro, i think they have a course dinner, or something. we were all confused and finally asked him to explain to us he said "you can order whatever from the menu..." well DAH!!!!!!!!
3)apptizer came, we had so much small/share plates that we were so lost! 
4) they had problem placing forks and knives...maybe you should know which side it goes????
5) open table says its "business casual"...i think its more super casual if someone is wearing sweat-pants and baseball hat to the restuarant. 
6) he opened another bottle of water even though we didn't order, my husband said we will order champagne LATER and he brought the menu to us right after to ask what we want....well can't you see we are STILL drinking wine?!?!?!?!

but overall it was good. food was tasty not the best but good!
author: Sisi W.

description: Dine About Town pulled us into great new French find in SOMA.  Use a strong push to get into their restaurant because the door is pretty heavy.  Once your inside, its a quaint and cozy place plus you're greeted with a "Hello" in a heavy French accent.  It proves the authenticity of the place.  The wait staff is funny and friendly, making you feel like you're at home.  We ordered from the Dine About Town menu.  I went with the Chicken\Vegetable Terrine (It would make a really good sandwich filling) to start, Lamb Osso Bucco (Reminded me that Lamb isn't as gamey as I though!) and the Hazelnut Moose (Placed in a pool of Dark Chocolate and I love chocolate!)  My lady had the Beets (amazing goat cheese), Fish (Can't remember what kind, but its the only one on that menu and good), and the Warm Chocolate cake (Served with ice cream and preserved strawberries).  Can't forget the always appreciated "Crispy" Pommes Frites, they were just the way we like them and they have ketchup unlike some places- A Cot'e.  I really enjoyed it and I'd love to come back for the rib eye steak and the seafood basquaise.
author: Jason A.

description: Service was not the best for sure, but I don't really care about it, so the 3 stars are for the food. The coq au vin I had for main course was very salty, which the chef should've known better, and the texture was soft but not smooth, which the chef probably can't do much about. My friend's rack of lamb is also pretty salty, much to his delight. A main course with a mixture of seafood was delicious, but i forgot the name. Their lettuce salad is just like any other, but the wine selection excellent. Warm Chocolate gourmand for dessert is highly recommended, the creme brulee was a sweeter than I'd like. Seating is less crowded than I expected, ambiance is pretty nice. It's a fun place to try.
author: Wooptydoop L.

description: came here for a drink and some appetizers with a friend on a sunday night. the bar is small (seating for 4) and the restaurant is intimate and happy. the older gentleman (who runs the place i think) was incredibly hospitable and gracious. he recommended some great (and ironically the cheaper) wines on the menu, and the prawns appetizer with anise was heavenly. the other staff seemed very friendly and the place has a good energy overall! definitely coming back here...
author: Luvlife R.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in SF! Tonight was my 6th time there, and my 3rd time taking advantage of their Dine About Town special. Fringale means "the urge to eat" in French, and that is what going there entails, in the most pleasurable of ways. The Dine About Town prix fixe, at $31.95, is a steal since a normal dinner runs $44. Three choices are offered for the first course: soup du jour (or in this case, de la nuit, which was a potato garlic soup), beef carpaccio with a mustard sauce & crispy horseradish, or sauteed prawns in pastis with sun dried tomatoes. I had the carpaccio, which was as artfully presented as it was delicious. Three cylindrical leaves of chive formed a teepee above the crispy horseradish and tiny spinach leaves salad in a sea of beef carpaccio. As I remarked to my friend, I could've eaten 5 more plates of this, but it was probably for the best, as we had our entrees and desserts to come, and the portions at Fringale are just right. Three choices again for the entree: sauteed ling cod (not really a cod, but a greenling) with white asparagus, lobster coulis, and a little bit of mashed potatoes; confit of duck leg with green lentils du Puy (French green lentils are grown in the Puy region); and Black Angus rib eye steak with red wine butter & pommes frites. I had the ling cod, which tasted great, and of course, the lobster coulis is so delicious, I mopped it up with some bread. My friend had the duck confit, and it was very earthy, rich, and delicious. Fringale is so cool, they offer every dessert on their dessert menu as part of the Dine About Town prix fixe (though I doubt the cheese plate is available). They were out of the apple tart, even though I had an 8PM reservation! So I ordered the Tarte Tatin de poire aux aromates (Carmelized Star Anise spiced pear), with vanilla ice cream. It came with tiny diced pineapples, a small sliver of mango, and a small sliver of strawberry, as well as a dusting of sugar on the plate. The ice cream came with shaved almonds, a nice touch. The tarte tatin was yummy, and it was a nice dessert, not too much, not too little. My friend ordered the creme brulee, which was quite good. Fringale changed its chef, and new chef Thierry Clement is doing a great job at maintaining Fringale's ability to impart "the urge to eat" on diners!
author: Hao L.

description: A nice, quaint place that has a decent size menu so they can focus on the few things that they can make well. The place is not stuffy at all. Food was very good. The calamari and the filet mignon are great. They have a full bar and they make excellent cocktails as well. The only drawback? Well it seemed like the server could not wait until we ordered even though we've asked twice that we needed a few minutes. Sometimes, it just takes a while to focus on ordering when you are very much engaged in the conversation you have with your dinner companion. In this case, they didn't get it. I would've otherwise given them 4 stars.
author: Vincent L.

description: I went back to Fringale last week with a few friends.  I had been there about a year ago and remembered a great meal.  Well, it was just as good, maybe better this time.  They still have one of my favorite salads of all time--Frisee with a warm dressing, topped by a beautifully poached egg.  I followed that with Ahi, seared to perfection and then their Creme Brulee--so smooth and delicious.  Among the other items ordered at my table were the Beef Carpaccio and the Prawns sauteed in Pastis as appetizers, and then the Duck Confit with lentils, and the Rack of Lamb for main dishes.  We all agreed that everything turned out wonderfully, perfectly cooked with excellent presentation.   Service was by some friendly, French waiters who knew their trade.  Wine selection was good with many reasonably-priced bottles.  Over all Fringale turns out to be, once again, a great choice for dinner!  We'll be back!
author: Barbara D.

description: I learned about sweatbreads at Fringale and believe me did not order them for dinner after I found out what they were BUT everything else was fantastic.  Great wine list, service and food.   I love French cuisine but if you have never had it this is a good intro to a variety of things and it is really fantastic. The place is small but you don't feel like your in your neighbors face.
author: Misti L.

description: this is the kinda place u'll see table after table of sugar daddies and cougars. so, if the food isn't electrifying, the crowd sure is. the age difference between most couples are 20 years. i was lucky enough to sit between, yes between two glammed up couples. one being a mid 50-s man with an asian boy who looked 12, but was probably 19. the stories were dull, but it was nice to have quietness since ms. thang next to me (mid 60's) was chattin' up a storm to her hustler. their conversation was too saucy to expose, plus i am here writing about the resturant...so, the food is ok, but for the money, it is hyped. eat an appetizer share the cheapest bottle of wine on the menu and make a night of it. btw, if ur curious, my date was 26 years older and rich as a golden nugget.
author: ray c.

description: This is our first time here, and it was OMG amazing.  A friend of mine was in town and wanted me to choose a restaurant that's non-asian to eat at.  I, of course not being from SF, had to go to my sources to find out where is a good place to eat.  A good friend of ours recommended this place.  My friend that was in town really wanted good ambiance, great food, a little on the romantic side, and nothing too expensive.  So I choose this one, and he said this place was down the street from his hotel where he was staying too.  Anyway...long story short, this is the first time in a long time that we all just dug into our food without taking photos of our food.  It was really really good.  Everything just melt in our mouths.  My friends tried the lamb, they don't usually order it cause people don't know how to cook it right.  I had the halibut and that was so moist, and my boyfriend and friend had the duck confit. Then it was time for some dessert.  Everything is great portion size and price is not overly expensive.  I am very impressed with it.  The best part I liked is that it wasn't very loud where we can't hear each other talk.  I think our table maybe the loudest, but still wasn't very loud.  I would come here again and highly recommend this place to everyone.
author: Amy A.

description: it's been three months since i last ate at fringale and i could recite what i ate from memory.  but i won't bore you with details.  let me just share the highlights...the beef carpaccio, the lobster ravioli, the seafood basquaise and the best pommes frites this side of the seine.  plus, the service is great  - it's attentive without being overly attentive.  and i'm just a sucker for french accents..food just tastes better when served by zee french.  fairly priced for a tres magnifique meal...bon appetit!
author: Jessica W.

description: came here before the animal masquerade, with my friend's new jersey relatives. it was quite nummy. i was really just tagging along for the dinner part, so i only ordered something light, the portobello  mushroom napoleon which turned out to be a bit of polenta with spinach, peppers and mushroom piled up. really, really good. but definitely a place where you need to order the first and second plate, otherwise you will be hungry. or have room for dessert, which is also excellent. i had the hot chocolate cake with berries and ice cream. the jersey relatives looked a bit bewildered at the french style and high prices, they didnt order the first plate either...
author: rachel a.

description: This place is kind of wonderful.  I've been twice now, once for a full dinner and last night for a bite and a drink.  Both great experiences.  The staff is incredibly helpful in selecting dishes and wines.  The food is well above par.  Fresh and delicious the way that French food should be.  My husband is obsessed with the foie gras terrine.  Obsessed.
author: Margaret S.

description: I'd been wanting to try this restaurant for a while as it was highly recommended by some of my friends, who have come here often. I loved the small, intimate atmosphere and the really helpful staff. We had a syrah (really really good) and another red that wasn't as memorable, but still good. The mussels were amazingly aromatic and really flavorful, but unfortunately the butterfish we ordered wasn't well seasoned and came off a little too bland for our tastes. Beforehand, we were warned not to have the fish here. We should have stuck to that rule, but the call of the butterfish was too strong.
author: Jolene C.

description: Valentine's Day was the first time I've eaten at Fringale in about four years.  What a disappointment!  The amuse bouche was a little funky.  It had a huge dollop of whipped cream on a savory carrot soup.  The appetizers were okay.  My partner and I both had the Fillet Mignon. I had to send mine back twice before it was cooked properly (both times it was over cooked) and my partner had to send his back once (the first time it was deader than dead over cooked).  My chocolate heart dessert was uninspiring and didn't taste that good.  My partner's creme brule was watery.  When I brought all this up to the general manager just as a matter of fact, he made me feel as if he didn't have time for me and wasn't interested.  I wasn't offered an apology or any recompense.  Considering the price at $75 per person, the overall experience and the meal was a huge disappointment.  The only saving grace was the bottle of wine I picked out.  We will *not* be returning.
author: Erik J.

description: went for dine about town and i really liked my meal... had this lamb dish and i remember being scared that it would be really rich but it wasn't!  the lamb was perfectly tender and not rich at all-- really enjoyed.  this is coming from someone who only recently decided they liked lamb, in fact i think this was the first time i ordered it (usually i would just try my boyfriend's--he always gets lamb).  anyway, the reason why i didn't want it to be too rich was because i was not even hungry when we walked in (had a big lunch--what was i thinking?) but i ended up eating up my whole 3 course meal.  the dessert was also memorable, got a pear tart if i recall correctly.  yummy!  definitely will be back to try again sometime.  great service too.
author: Yvette H.

description: kinda has the old soma bizou kinda vibe. makes me feel nostagic.  other than that, id say its midrange sf french food, a little lower than like chapeau, about the same as chou chou.
author: christopher a.

description: Not all DAT participants put some of their best items on the price fixe menu, but Fringale definitely does not disappoint!  This is especially impressive given that, unlike some participant menus, the normal  prices at Fringale are HIGH (though **mostly** worth it).  I chose the prawn app - spicy prawns in a creamy, flavorful sauce featuring sun-dried tomatoes.  I forgot that I had a steak coming, and ate all the prawns and sopped up every spot of sauce with the bucket of french bread on our table. By the time I was full, my rib eye arrived, served with a side of pommes frittes.  I generally enjoy lean cuts of beef, so was initially taken aback at the gristle on the rib eye. My date, however, instructed me to cut off the gristle and enjoy the middle... SO GLAD I DID.  The meat was so flavorful, with just enough seasoning.  I have to agree with a previous yelper that the fries weren't the greatest... dry, no real flavor.  My date ordered the lamb and was sort of disappointed. I would have been too. Although the meat had a great flavor, it was less-than-appetizing looking, and was served with a meager stew of cabbage, potatoes and carrots.  There also seemed to be a lack of edible meat on the shank itself.  Probably his fault for not sending it back.  Luckily, I had an ENORMOUS steak, and my date split my dish with me (enjoying every morsel).  Desert on  my end was the warm chocolate cake.. you probably can't go wrong with warm choc. cake.. but YUMMMY!  Wine / wine service was great too.  In fact, all service was great.  Don't order the lamb, but everything else makes for an intimate and delicious meal.
author: Jenni D.

description: Went with a group for lunch - took a cab but it looked like there was parking available if you go that way - and am SO HAPPY that we went!  As a Yelper I check first to see what I'm getting into, so read the reviews, went to the website and looked up the menu, etc.  Found out that Thierry Clement was gone and Chef Mauldin was in, cool, fresh insight is always welcome.  I found only one "real" vegetarian dish on the menu, so I called a day before and asked if perhaps they might be able to expand that a little for me.  They did, and it may have been the most perfect lunch I've had in years!  It started with a salad of mache and shaved dry jack, and followed with a dark-colored risotto with wild mushrooms.  The flavors of each component were fresh and distinct from one another.  Plus bien!  Our table ordered one of every dessert and shared without anything but squeals of delight.  Always the Francophile, I ordered a snifter of Chartreuse verte with dessert and was filled with its mellow warmth.  Our waiter and the other staff were attentive, charming, quick, and accurate.  I couldn't have asked for a better dining experience.  Merci beaucoups, Fringale!
author: Diana R.

description: food was fine. service was fine. everything was fine, but just fine. its sort of out of the way, the menu isnt traditionally french, the lighting is fairly bright and all in all it left no impression. i suggest Le Charm for a nice french date spot that most people dont know about.
author: EM F.

description: food was good but nothing to brag about but maybe i was just bitter they were out of the bread pudding.
author: David F.

description: Fringale is so cozy and intimate, you almost forget you are in one of the least charming neighborhoods in the city. I went here with my family a few days after Christmas. I had the beet salad, shortribs, and almond tart. The beet salad was a little bland--it needed a sharper dressing. I had several bites of my sister's frisee salad, which was fantastic. I will definitely order the frisee salad next time. The veal shortribs were delicious, though so rich that I couldn't finish them. I tried my dad's seafood basquaise and my brother's rack of lamb and thought they were both outstanding, as well as the potato galette that was served with the rack of lamb. Almond tart was delicious. Our waitress recommended a bottle of wine that we all liked so much that we have since bought several more bottles of it.
author: Emily S.

description: Good food and wine. The staff was friendly but a little overwhelmed , as we were in a fairly large group (12 people). The restaurant is smallish so its probably not a good place for a "group dinner" . The food was extremely well presented and great tasting to boot.
author: Naveen P.

description: Fringale is a great place to have dinner.  The roast chicken is one of my favorites - tasty and just wonderful.  They have great wines and the atmosphere is wonderful.  Good place to take a date or just go for the good food. On Tuesdays, you can eat and go Salsa Dancing at the GlasKat.  Always good bands and fun dancing.  Women also get in free before 8:30 so they can get the free dance lessons.
author: John M.

description: This is my first time at Fringale. We came here for dine-about-town in SF. They have great appetizers. A must try are the Fois Gras with mango puree, calamari, and Dungeness  Crab Napoleon. As for the entree, I had the Hanger Steak which consist of 2 small chunks of beef, fanatic fries and string beans but the beef was a little chewy. My friend had the sole but had diarrhea right after the dinner. I tried a small piece and it was extremely salty. We tried the Hazelnut mousse cake and the creme brulee and bother were very good.  My experience with Fringale was very nice and the staff was helpful as well.
author: Liana C.

description: i had a really great meal here the other night.  we had a large party, so we were able to sample a variety of things.  for appetizers, the lobster ravioli, calamari w/ peppers and chorizo, frisee salad w/ warm bacon dressing and a poached egg, and artichoke salad were standouts.  also excellent were the pomme frites.  i had the grilled hawaiian walu for my entree, which was a very delicate white fish w/ a light citrus sauce.  i tried some of my other friends' dishes, and the ny steak w/ wild mushrooms and pomme frite was delish.  the flourless chocolate cake and creme brulee were nice standard desserts that were both simple yet good.  the assorted cookies w/ homemade truffles came w/ madelines and other very small cookies which weren't that memorable.  all in all, a very nice meal.
author: Helen T.

description: Wow, I absolutely loved this place.  We stopped by here at around 6pm on a Saturday and were able to sit at the bar. We started of with half a bottle of pinot noir and french onion soup. The  soup was delicious, a great start to a wonderful meal to come. I ordered Hawaiian Mongchong and my boyfriend  got the mussels. Both dishes were very tasty. The fish came with mushroom sauce and fingerling potatoes and I finished every little piece of it stopping myself from actually licking the plate ( I don't think our waiter would have appreciated that)  I tried some mussels as well and i have to say they are the best mussels I had in a while.  For dessert we had hazelnut mousse and coffee. The service was impeccable even at the bar. The noise level was pretty low so it was easy to carry a conversation.  Everyone there is very attentive and of course speaks French. Lovely restaurant for a romantic meal. Next time we will probably call ahead to make reservations and sit at the table though. I highly recommend this restaurant   if you plan to be in SOMA.
author: Maria V.

description: probably one of the best french restaurants i've been to.  very quaint.. went during dine about town last month with some friends and had an awesome time.. the sole was AWESOME.
author: Elaine G.

description: First time at this Basque-inspired bistro, but we'll surely be back.  Great service.  Robust wine list (and not even a hint of a snicker from the French waitstaff when we selected a California cabernet.)  Intimate, albeit borderline cramped, atmosphere.  Did I say mouthwatering?  We visited for Valentine's Day Dinner and had some spectacular cuisine.  Best meal all year!  (OK, we're only 6 weeks in.)  As amuse-gueule, the carrot soup was even ahead of my heretofore favorite recipe.  The foie gras with pineapple chutney and Petrale Sole stuffed with scallops and shrimp were quite good, but the avocado-laced crab Napoleon and Black Angus filet mignon were truly amazing.  And the bread - we couldn't stop noshing on it!  For the finale, the chocolate & raspberry heart topped all cocoa this year, whilst the sorbets surpassed all in a lifetime.  I still wonder how they could possibly stuff such rich fruit -- including overpoweringly intense mango -- into frozen water?
author: Scott A.

description: tasty, casual, one of the best. -0.5 for wine selection
author: Angie Y.

description: did the DAT for lunch a couple of weeks ago.  it's been raining like crazy, but man... it gets really crowded there at lunch time also.  i can't imagine how dinner would be like.   so i had the lamb stew for lunch.  it was very tender and cook just right.  dessert was awesome...  hazlenut chocolate with LOTS of rum in the chocolate.  i mean... LOTS.  :)  other than that... i would say my experience there was quite satisfying.    i did keep seeing a small bug on the table to myself.  i guess when it rains...  stuff do get in the cracks. :P
author: jay c.

description: I came here last night with my friends for a birthday. We originally made reservations for 7, but last minute my bf decided to come. They had no problem with seating 8 instead of 7 so that was good. They were very nice and courteous. We came here because of the Dine About Town which is the greatest idea ever! (Kudos to whoever thought of the whole idea!) I had the Mussels for the first course which were sooooo delicious! My second choice was the salmon which was okay. They put a lot of lemon juice on it, which I don't particularly like. For the last course, I chose to go with the apple tarte with vanilla ice cream. That was yummy as well! We actually hadn't told the waiters that it was our friend's birthday, and we started singing happy birthday when our desserts came. Our waiter then came out with some truffles and a candle as he had heard us singing. I don't know why we hadn't thought of telling them before hand. But they were very nice! I think I would come again.
author: Steph C.

description: So I had to post a new review since I just took my girlfriend here for dinner and we had such a good experience. Yes I'm all about the internet so I made my reservation on Opentable.com and asked for a table by the window (tip it gets really warm and it's a small place, best table is by the window in the corner. Has the most space between tables). So they call to confirm and the waiter with the French accent has that " French I could care less what you we assures me he would try. When we arrive score we got a window table. Our waiter was great and the food was terrific. We got the calamari with Chorizo and olives. The calamari was done sooo perfect, tender not rubbery at all. I got the lamb which was cooked exactly as I asked for and my gf's seafood dish was tasty. Had I not order a side of their pomme fritz (I'm a sucker for fries with aoli at French restaurants) I think we would have ordered desert.
author: Hyung L.

description: I went here for Dine About Town for lunch and everything was very good.  At first, we were disappointed they didn't have the calamari appetizer as listed on the DAT website, but we both had the sauteed prawns in pastis with sun dried tomatoes and we were very happy with the substitution.  For our entrees, I had the petrale sole and my friend had the coq au vin, and for dessert, I had the hazelnut and roasted almond mousse cake and my friend had the creme brulee, all delicious.  We left full and happy.  Another good DAT experience.
author: Susan Y.

description: I accidentally came here thinking it was dine about town but that didn't start till a week later! oh well, we got dinner anyway and it was actually pretty good French food and friendly service. I wasn't blown away or anything but it's decent prices and decent food. I wish I had gotten the steak looking at the plate next to me so if I ever decide to come back, which I probably will, that's what I'm gonna go for.
author: pankaj l.

description: Meh, overpriced and not that good.  My appetizer was tasty (don't remember what it was).  I had the duck confit for entree, which was dry and didn't come with much else save a boatload of lentils that I couldn't finish.  I've had better for less at other restaurants.  Not worth it!
author: Chris C.

description: why haven't i been to this place while living in the city for a decade?  had 3 starters and all entrees were fab tonight, wonderful, reasonable wine.  plus the authentic frency wait staff tres bien!  i'l be back...soon!
author: e w.

description: i think i was the youngest patron at dinner that night, and i'm no spring chicken.  i will return for the hangar steak.  it was melt-in-your-mouth juicy!
author: Big e.

description: Very poor service. Pretentious, loads of attitude. Do not bother, you will regret it. There are plenty of other places nearby like the wonderful Coco 500 or Bacar.
author: erik p.

description: Don't spend your money here. There are places way better.  Service was rude sometimes.  My hot tea was always cold.  The steak was loaded with fat. My salad was salty.  I won't go there again.  Definately not good for groups.  Only thing good is the place was cozy.
author: A N.

description: I can't speak that well towards the regular menu since I've only been here on valentines day when there was a fixed menu and price. The food we had was excellent and I remember making some substitutions with appetizers so that we could try all three desserts. The service was wonderful and totally willing to help us place our weird order. All in all, this is a place I'd definitely visit again.
author: Avid E.

description: Heard so much about its great food and yes, I agree! Went with a couple of friends as part of D.A.T. On a rainy Friday night, it was more than worth it! It was my first time to try their fare. From the PEI mussels to the coq au vin to their hazelnut mousse... delish! Price and service were great too! Will be back many times for sure!
author: Maite d.

description: I went to Fringale for dinner, and we tried the dine about town menu, which was way delicious.  The service was friendly, and the whole place has a nice neighborhood feel to it.  My only complaint is that the seating area is a bit crowded, so my chair kept getting bumped every time another customer or waiter walked by.  I would try to get a table by the window next time.  All in all, I had a great experience, and I would definitely try this place again!
author: Sharon C.

description: This place was delicious.  I had the veal (sorry baby cow) and it was melt in your mouth good!  I thought the service was very good, wine delicious, atmosphere nice... I was actually very impressed.  I NEVER order veal, but now I have been craving it.  It was cooked perfectly!!
author: Jessica S.

description: This was our first time at Fringale. French food never tasted so outrageously delicious before. From roasted peppers that melt in your mouth, to unbelievably fresh pan roasted calamari, to mouth watering cuts of meat - food at this SOMA treasure just blew all my other gourmet dining experiences in the city out of the water. Attentive wait staff (with an entertaining French accent) took care of us very well. It was my wife's birthday - I had mentioned this while making the reservation. Without any awkward gestures or prodding, the server brought us a complimentary custard creme puff plate with a birthday candle just as we were getting ready to order desserts! I highly recommend Fringale for a memorable dining experience.
author: Vinod N.

description: Friday evening early Dec.  Four of us.  Leah, our waitress, had a wonderful french accent.  The timing of her service was perfect:  she niether neglected nor hovered over us.  She offered good suggestions about wine and food.  The drinks were served promptly and acompanied by a basket of good fresh bread.  Food took a little while which is to be expected for freshly made excellent food.  The wine reduction for my canard magrets was truly perfect - don't know that I've ever had such a perfect sauce before - though perhaps there could have been just a little more of it.  and the minced vegetale with it was just the perfect touch and taste.  My companions had the duck confit, steak, and pork wrapped in bacon -- all of which were reported to be very very good.  At the very end there was a slight hint that some folks were waiting for tables, but otherwise the servcie was great.  The prices were very reasonable for the excellent qualityof the food and service, especially compared to elsewhere in the city.  I rarely eat out (except when on vacation) because I often feel ripped off and I am made to feel that I am doing the restaurant a service.  Fringales for me is a treat.  I am looking forward to visiting again.
author: A F.

description: Very good food and wine list.  Waiters helpful in matching wine to specific dishes.  SMALL and can be a pain when it is full.
author: Brian R.

description: Amazing food! More Basquaise than French! Great service! Great ambience! Awesome experieence overall.
author: ila v.

description: I made a reservation several weeks in advance to celebrate my mother's birthday at Fringale. We had hoped for an enjoyable dinning experience but all night we felt somewhat rushed by the waiter (asking us for our order directly after we sat down, etc). After we had finished our main course and were enjoying our champagne, WE WERE ASKED TO LEAVE BECAUSE PEOPLE WERE WAITING FOR THE TABLE. WE HADN'T EVEN LOOKED AT THE DESSERT MENU YET!! I have never been treated so rudely and inappropriately in a restaurant. And to call themselves a French/Basque restaurant is an utter disgrace. The food may be good, but San Francisco is filled with excellent restaurants that treat their guests properly .The owner has his priorities completely backward. Needless to say, I will never go back and I strongly recommend avoiding Fringale.
author: beatriz G.

description: Had dinner here and it was great...good atmosphere for a date, food was excellent - had the butter leaf salad and the almond crusted sea bass. I will be going back:)
author: Rebecca C.

description: Great food, good service, and a quaint cozy environment.  Not too fancy but nice, the service is good (not great), and the food is very good.  I loved the shrimp appetizer, it was incredible with an excellent sauce.  I would highly recommend this restaurant as a medium to above average priced restaurant.  The food and experience is definitely worth the price.
author: Rob P.

description: I was very disappointed especially after reading all these great reviews. First was the environment. The table we were first seated at had gnats and flies circling and hanging out on the window...and I'm not just talking about 1-2. There were many gnats with one taking a sip out of my cup of water. Second was when they moved us and they never apologized. Instead the wait staff just made a joke out of it and that was the end of that. And to top it off, there were gnats at the table we were moved to because of old flowers sitting in a tin vase right next to the table. So at that point I just wanted a good meal and didn't get it. Apps were good, but then it went downhill from there. I would recommend Bistro Liaison in Berkeley over this place every time. Better food, prices, service and ambiance there compared to Fringale. Sorry, I wanted to write a good review but they did everything wrong.
author: Jae C.

description: I had a very special occasion dinner last night at Fringale -- what USED TO be my favorite SF restaurant.  I had let the restaurant know about this special birthday dinner in advance, but alot of good that did.  When we walked in, we stood there for approx 10 minutes without being acknowledged.  When I asked the bartender if the host was around, he told me to "just be patient..."  We were seated by the harried host who spoke not a word to us.  The waiter, though cute with his French accent, did not know the house wine list AT ALL.  Repeated requests for water - after ordering it initially and re-requesting it- went unacknowledged.  Although we were clearly ready to order wine, they threw our entrees down on the table, long before we had anything to drink with them.  The food was quite good, but the service really lacked. There was no acknowledgement of the birthday person's special day, after confirming and reconfirming the occasion with the restaurant - who gave us a mediocre table by the way.  We ordered one dessert to share, which they did bring with a birthday candle, but then charged us for it - something I thought tacky as the bill was well over $200.  I had pulled the waiter aside away from the table and given him my credit card, asking him to handle this stealthily so the birthday person (my Dad) would not try to pay.  At the end of the evening he threw the bill down in front of me while all were watching - really badly handled - defeating the point of trying to avoid the struggle for the check.   I rarely tip less than 20% - there has to be a reason - but I did less last night..  No excuse for the waiter not knowing the basics about their featured wines.  Maybe Fringale has become a victim of it's own success? The harried host might need to find another line of work if he is in the weeds on your average Saturday night.  While the food was still excellent, there is no excuse for such a slipshod performance by what was one a stellar restaurant.
author: Sue M.

description: great prices, great food, great service, fun french bistro.... go.
author: michael k.

description: Took a team of 7 for a celebration - we had an early (6p) reservation when this lovely, intimate restaurant was still quiet.  Dinner was fantastic - everyone loved their food. Calamari, crab and avacado salad, duck confit and venison were the highlights. The Merry Edwards Pinot was a perfect complement, and we finished with a lovely cheese plate. Our waiter was charming and attentive but not overbearing. Towards the end of the meal, it got quite crowded - a large party that they were seating at an enormous table which they created by bringing in a huge piece of plywood top running the length of the restaurant on top of their regular tables . This was a bit annoying...I got hit in the head with table linens as they put out the tablecloth and one of my colleagues got a pretty good hit to the back with a chair. The waiter brought our bill (~$750 for 7 of us) - told us "no rush". We enjoyed the last of the cheese plate, the 3rd of our bottles of wine, coffee and port when the manager came over and announced that he needed the table. No apology, no "please" . Though I had a wonderful dinner the final experience left a really bad taste in my mouth. To his credit, our waiter came over as we were leaving and apologized, but, there are a lot of great restaurants I would go back to before visiting Fringale again.
author: Cathi A.
